subject: Sales
title: Why We Follow the Crowd
description: A quick, practical guide to Why We Follow the Crowd.

hook.text: You check ratings before eating out and reviews before buying. We all follow the crowd.

buildup.text: Social proof is the shortcut that says: if others chose it, it's probably safe and good.

discovery.text: Cialdini ranked social proof among the six most powerful persuasion forces in human psychology.

twist.text: Social proof is fragile. One viral complaint can undo a thousand five-star reviews overnight.

climax.text: Smart companies don't just collect proof. They showcase it at the exact moment of decision.

punchline.text: We trust the crowd more than the company.

quiz.question: Who ranked social proof among the six key persuasion principles?
